Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] PUT or POST

Zhi-Qiang Lei wrote:
> 
> I want my resource expose its created time or updated time in
> representation. But seems to PUT a update means that the value is
> inputed by client. I want it to be assigned by server but client.
> Does it means that I have to use POST? Thanks.
> 

No.  The server can do whatever it wants with the PUT, so long as it's
idempotent.  The user-agent sends a timestamp, the server ignores it
and uses its own.  Perfectly fine.

-Eric
